label: 螺鈿
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
説明文: A decorative lacquer technique in which smooth pieces of mother-of-pearl from turban or other shells are adhered to a lacquered surface and covered with another layer of lacquer. Lacquer is then removed from the shell surfaces. Another method of inlaying shell is to carve out shallow beds into a wooden surface in which to embed the shells directly. Inlaid shell pieces are often incised with delicate hairline engraving.
